metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17014 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: If an image had not loaded correctly (such as when it is not actually an image), it could be dragged and dropped cross-domain, resulting in a cross-origin information leak. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 71.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0+build5-0ubuntu1').
